name: Ramona Holiday Wine Trail

venue.name: Ramona Main Street
venue.address: Ramona Main Street

desc: Purchase tickets and receive a wine glass along with visiting 15+ participating wineries offering 3 tastes of wine. Each winery has different events planned. This purchase allows participation for all 3 weekends.

name: Meet Santa the Holidays

venue.name: Fashion Valley Mall
venue.address: Fashion Valley Mall 7007 Friars Road, San Diego, 92108

desc: Santa will be available until Christmas Eve, offering a memorable holiday experience for all ages. Guests can reserve an extended, personalized photo session with the Signature Santa Experience. Reservations for this elevated photo session are available for a limited time through December 6. Traditional photo packages are also available.

name: Jazz Brunch

venue.name: Brick Hotel
venue.address: The Brick Hotel 408 Pier View Way, Oceanside, 92054

desc: Every Sunday, join The Soto Six Quartet for jazz brunch at The Brick Hotel. Music takes place on the Succulent Coffee Patio, and all ages are welcome to attend with no cover charge.

name: Your Local Theatre Presents: A Christmas Carol, by Charles Dickens, Again

venue.name: La Jolla Playhouse
venue.address: La Jolla Playhouse 2910 La Jolla Village Drive, San Diego, 92037

desc: Your Local Theater Presents: A Christmas Carol, by Charles Dickens, Again is a laugh-out-loud funny and heartfelt story for theatre lovers and holiday enthusiasts alike. Eddie is a young actor, fresh out of Juilliard and ready to make his mark on the American Theatre. His dreams are within reach… sort of. First he’s just going to do this regional production of A Christmas Carol. As the years pass, Eddie finds himself back at the same local theatre, over and over and over again. Much remains the same: the play, the stage manager, the green room — though Eddie finds himself in different costumes as he ages through the male roles over the course of his career. Anna Ouyang Moench’s comedic and moving new play is a love letter to actors, artists and dreamers of all professions who make sacrifices large and small in service of their work… and ultimately wonder whether it was worth it.

name: Macrame & Sea Glass Christmas Ornament Workshop

venue.name: Negociant Hillcrest Urban Winery
venue.address: Negociant Hillcrest Urban Winery 1263 University Avenue, San Diego, 92103

desc: Learn to make macrame and sea glass ornaments.

name: Bubble Bash Tasting Event

venue.name: San Pasqual Wine Bar and Gallery
venue.address: San Pasqual Wine Bar and Gallery 8364 La Mesa Boulevard, La Mesa, 91942

desc: San Pasqual Winery is celebrating 15 years at their downtown La Mesa Tasting Room. Guests can try up to 10 different sparkling wines, including the return of Brut Rosé. There will also be sparkling wine gift sets available and a $10 discount on bottle purchases during the event.

name: Mission Trails Native American Flute Circle

venue.name: Mission Trails Regional Park
venue.address: Mission Trails Regional Park One Father Junípero Serra Trail, San Carlos, 92119

desc: Enjoy the peaceful views and the beautiful, inspiring music. This is an open-mic session on a rotational basis and welcomes all levels of players. We certainly appreciate those who would just like to come, listen, and learn stories behind the music. Players use a variety of flutes, including some you’ve probably never seen. Depending on the weather, the session will be in the outdoor Amphitheater or inside in the Visitor Center library.

venue.name: Manchester Grand Hyatt
venue.address: Manchester Grand Hyatt One Market Place, San Diego, 92101

desc: With a chill in the air, Rooftop Cinema Club Embarcadero is ratcheting up the comfort and intimacy with the introduction of a new activation, Fireside Films.

name: Photos by the Sea with Santa

venue.name: Del Mar Plaza
venue.address: Del Mar Plaza 1555 Camino del Mar, Del Mar, 92104

desc: Guests are encouraged to dress up their little ones and furry friends, write letters to the North Pole and take holiday photos with Santa featuring a backdrop of the Pacific Ocean.

name: The Ladygang

venue.name: House of Blues
venue.address: House of Blues 1055 Fifth Avenue, San Diego, 92101

desc: You Never Forget Your First Tour

name: Christmas Concert: Magnificat

venue.name: Nativity Catholic Church
venue.address: Nativity Catholic Church 6309 El Apajo Road, Rancho Santa Fe, 92067

desc: The 3rd Annual Christmas Concert features The Nativity Choir, an ensemble of San Diego’s finest vocalists who will be joined by San Diego Baroque, a collaborative ensemble made up of early music specialists with Dr. Alison Luedecke, Music Director. Admission is free. There will be a freewill offering with all proceeds going to support the Nativity Music Program.

name: Manny & The Wise Queens

venue.name: Sunshine Brooks Theatre
venue.address: Sunshine Brooks Theatre 217 N. Coast Highway, Oceanside, 92054

desc: OTC presents the first full staging of Manny and the Wise Queens, introducing audiences to the small town of Bethlehem, U.S.A., where a bright star draws distant visitors to usher in a new era one December night in 2020. The gift-bearing travelers find themselves in the attic of Manny, a depressed recent high school graduate, who has locked himself away to escape the remnants of holiday cheer in his quarantined town. Luckily, the sudden arrival of the two wise queens provides a potential key to Manny’s deliverance. Written by Idris Goodwin and directed by Jacole Kitchen.

name: Two Concertos: Barnatan Plays Shostakovich

venue.name: Jacobs Music Center
venue.address: Jacobs Music Center 750 B Street, San Diego, 92101

desc: Conducted by Music Director Rafael Payare and featuring pianist Inon Barnatan, this program highlights the humorous side of classical music in works by Richard Strauss and Dmitri Shostakovich. Strauss wrote his tone poem Don Juan when he was just 24 years old.

name: Luminosity: Colorists Past and Present

venue.name: Mandeville Auditorium at UCSD
venue.address: Mandeville Auditorium at UCSD 9500 Gilman Drive, San Diego, 92093

desc: With the natural world serving as a recurring metaphor in her compositions, Gabriella Smith's sonically imaginative piece, Bioluminescence Chaconne, sets the stage for our program. Acclaimed soloist Nancy Zhou shares her mesmerizing virtuosity in Vivian Fung's gamelan-inspired Violin Concerto No. 1. In the latter half of the performance, the La Jolla Symphony Chorus joins the orchestra, presenting a vibrant selection of French masterpieces by Debussy, Fauré, and Ravel.

venue.name: Folk Arts Rare Records
venue.address: Folk Arts Rare Records 3072 El Cajon Boulevard, San Diego, 92104

name: A Christmas Carol

venue.name: Cygnet Theatre
venue.address: Cygnet Theatre 4040 Twiggs Street, San Diego, 92110

desc: This year’s production features new elements including fresh original music, an expanded storyline, and a revitalized script with imaginative stagecraft, puppetry, live sound effects, and all the heartwarming tradition you love.

name: A New Brain

venue.name: Prebys Stage
venue.address: Prebys Stage 6075 Aztec Circle, San Diego

desc: By the Tony Award-winning authors of Falsettos, here is a comical musical about a composer during a medical emergency. One day, Gordon collapses into his lunch and awakes in the hospital, surrounded by his maritime-enthusiast lover, his mother, a co-worker, the doctor, and the nurses. This medical ordeal jolts Gordon as he finds himself haunted by his unfinished work while he questions his priorities and plans. Book by William Finn and James Lapine, music and lyrics by William Finn, directed by Josh Walden.

name: Paint Party

venue.name: Art Scene West Seaport Village
venue.address: Art Scene West Seaport Village 849 West Harbor Drive, San Diego, 92101

desc: Enjoy a guided painting activity. All supplies are included and guests will take home their painting. Parking validated.

name: Dr. Seuss’s How the Grinch Stole Christmas

venue.name: Old Globe - Donald & Darlene Shiley Stage
venue.address: Old Globe - Donald & Darlene Shiley Stage 1363 Old Globe Way, San Diego, 92101

desc: Back for its 27th year, the family favorite features the songs “Santa for a Day,” “You’re a Mean One, Mr. Grinch,” and “Welcome, Christmas (Fah Who Doraze).”

name: Miracle On 34th Street: Live Musical Radio Play

venue.name: New Village Arts Theatre
venue.address: New Village Arts Theatre 2787 B State Street, Carlsbad, 92008

desc: Told in the style of a radio play and created by San Diego artists Jon Lorenz and Lance Arthur Smith, with live Foley effects and a score of holiday carols.

name: Ken Ludwig's Twas the Night Before Christmas

venue.name: Lamplighters Community Theatre
venue.address: Lamplighters Community Theatre 5915 Severin Drive, La Mesa, 91942

desc: 'Twas the night before Christmas, when all through the house, not a creature was stirring, not even a mouse." But wait. A mouse is stirring - because Santa missed his house last year. Before you can say “Merry Christmas,” we're off on the wild adventures of a mouse, an elf, and a spunky little girl who visit the North Pole and just won't take no for an answer. Featuring: River Baig, Dani Guinn, Thomas Jarrett, Chris Miller, Matt Sayre, and Dani Ucman.

name: Stand Up for Kids

venue.name: Mic Drop Comedy
venue.address: Mic Drop Comedy 8878 Clairemont Mesa Boulevard, San Diego

desc: Does your child have a knack for making people laugh? Enroll them in our six-week stand-up comedy workshop designed for kids ages 8 to 15 years old at Mic Drop Comedy! This fun and engaging program will help them develop a 5-minute set to perform in front of family and friends at the end of the course.

name: A Christmas Carol 2024

venue.name: Theatre for Young Professionals
venue.address: Theatre for Young Professionals 7960 University Avenue Suite 240, San Diego, 91942

desc: Enjoy a new adaptation of A Christmas Carol, written by Jordan Miller. This play will be a modern adaptation of Charles Dickens' timeless tale of Ebenezer Scrooge's greed and redemption. An LA party girl will be visited by four ghosts, who hope to open her heart to the plight of the poor and powerless in the world.

desc: Concert from the Greater San Diego Coterie Orchestra and the King of Kings Choir. Come sing Handel's Hallelujah Chorus.

name: Holiday Gondola Cruise

venue.name: Gondola Company
venue.address: The Gondola Company 503 Grand Caribe Causeway, Coronado, 92118

desc: Celebrate the magic of the season with a festive Holiday Gondola Cruise through the scenic canals and tranquil waterways of Coronado Cays. Enjoy an intimate, 50-minute cruise aboard a beautifully decorated gondola, complete with a holiday-themed gondolier. Great for couples or small groups.

name: Holiday Market

venue.name: Petco Park
venue.address: Petco Park 100 Park Boulevard, San Diego, 92101

desc: Experience the Holiday Market at Petco Park, a festive evening for the whole family. Explore Gallagher Square, now beautifully renovated and filled with local artisan shops, twinkling lights, seasonal food and drinks, and your favorite holiday characters. It’s a delightful way to enjoy the holiday season together!

name: San Diego Women's Chorus: Hope for the Holidays

venue.name: Lincoln High School
venue.address: Lincoln High School 4777 Imperial Avenue, San Diego, 92113

desc: Led by Artistic Director Kathleen Hansen, the winter concert offers a message of hope, love, and unity at a time when many feel the strain of division in society. The concert will feature a diverse selection of winter and holiday songs, highlighting the work of female and minority composers such as Sara Bareilles, Ingrid Michaelson, Joan Szymko, and more. Audiences will experience a range of musical styles, from traditional Scots, Gaelic, and British songs to a pop holiday hit, a medieval Spanish carol, and Tchaikovsky’s "Dance of the Sugar Plum Fairy."

venue.name: Museum of Making Music

desc: For over 30 years, Eric Rigler has been known for playing the bagpipes and Irish whistles.

SCHUBERT: STRING QUARTET No.13 IN A MINOR D 804 "ROSAMUNDE" Performed by: THE QUARTET INTEGRA KYOKA MISAWA, Violin, RINTARO KIKUNO, Violin, ITSUKO YAMAMOTO, Viola, YE UN PARK, Cello (Including high tea buffet with French Champagne after the performance)

venue.name: Pilgrim United Church of Christ
venue.address: Pilgrim United Church of Christ 2020 Chestnut Avenue, Carlsbad, 92008

desc: Born and raised in Kyoto, guitarist and songwriter Hiroya Tsukamoto received a scholarship to Berklee College of Music in 2000. Since then, he has been performing internationally including the United Nations, the Blue Note in New York, and Japanese National Television. Hiroya has released six albums, and won second place in the International Finger Style Guitar Championship in 2022.

venue.name: St. Mark's United Methodist Church
venue.address: St. Mark's United Methodist Church 3502 Clairemont Drive, San Diego, 92117

The Adult and Children’s Choirs, organ, piano, handbells, trumpet, timpani, and flute will fill the space with glorious music.

desc: Enjoy an up-close view of the 54th annual San Diego Bay Parade of Lights. Watch 80 decorated boats, themed "Christmas Traditions around the World." Enjoy a narrated cruise, drinks, and snacks from the comfort of a luxury yacht.

name: San Diego Bay Parade of Lights

venue.name: From Shelter Island to the Ferry Landing on Coronado
venue.address: From Shelter Island to the Ferry Landing on Coronado

desc: The San Diego Bay Parade of Lights brings more than 100,000 San Diego residents and visitors to the shores of San Diego Bay each year. The procession of approximately 80 lavishly decorated boats has become one of the most iconic events in the region. There is no cost to view the parade. This year, for the 6th time, the parade will proceed to the pier at Cesar Chavez Park before making the turn to Coronado, giving spectators another area to view the parade.

name: City Lights: An Immersive Journey Through Light & Sound

venue.name: Quartyard
venue.address: The Quartyard 1301 Market Street, San Diego, 92101

desc: Embark on a 50-minute journey through six unique zones – featuring lasers, reactive video, LED sculptures, projection mapping, and more – each inspired by a different aspect of city life. Interact with the art, transforming the visuals as you shape the experience with your movements. Two special zones feature choreographed light and sound performances, creating a powerful synergy that brings the city’s heartbeat to life. End the experience by indulging in an elevated cocktail lounge featuring a seasonal El Comal tapas-style menu.

desc: Your Local Theater Presents: A Christmas Carol, by Charles Dickens, Again is a laugh-out-loud funny and heartfelt story for theatre lovers and holiday enthusiasts alike. Eddie is a young actor, fresh out of Juilliard and ready to make his mark on the American Theatre. His dreams are within reach… sort of. First he’s just going to do this regional production of A Christmas Carol. As the years pass, Eddie finds himself back at the same local theatre, over and over and over again. Much remains the same: the play, the stage manager, the green room — though Eddie finds himself in different costumes as he ages through the male roles over the course of his career. Anna Ouyang Moench’s comedic and moving new play is a love letter to actors, artists and dreamers of all professions who make sacrifices large and small in service of their work… and ultimately wonder whether it was worth it.

venue.name: St. Andrew's by-the-Sea Episcopal Church
venue.address: St. Andrew's by-the-Sea Episcopal Church 1050 Thomas Avenue, San Diego, 92109

desc: The Dances of Universal Peace are a participatory experience combining movement, sound and breath. Honoring the many sacred traditions of humanity, this fun and easy practice promotes peace in the individual and awakening in the world, with live music, and open-hearted friends.

name: Jake Shimabukuro: Holidays in Hawaii

venue.name: Balboa Theatre
venue.address: Balboa Theatre 868 Fourth Avenue, San Diego, 92101

desc: Ukulele virtuoso and ambassador of aloha, Jake Shimabukuro, reimagines beloved holiday classics like “We Three Kings,” “O Holy Night,” “All I Want For Christmas Is You,” and “I’ll Be Home For Christmas.” The performance will also showcase selections from his new album Grateful. Joining Shimabukuro on stage will be the bassist Jackson Waldhoff and singer-songwriter Justin Kawika Young.

name: Jason Cheny

venue.name: Mic Drop Comedy
venue.address: Mic Drop Comedy 8878 Clairemont Mesa Boulevard, San Diego

desc: Jason Cheny is a Taiwanese American standup comedian based in Los Angeles. Jason has toured all over Asia including Singapore, Hong Kong, Taiwan, and in comedy clubs all across the US. He is a regular at the Comedy Cellar in NYC, and he has featured for Iliza Shlesinger, Ronny Chieng and Phil Wang. Jason can be seen on LAUGHS for Fox/Hulu and you can stream his comedy album Growing Pains which debuted at #1 on iTunes. Catch him on tour in a city near you!
